thread.title: Oman finishes 23rd in the 27th Nomura Cup
thread.title_full: Oman finishes 23rd in the 27th Nomura Cup

author: muscatdaily@apexmedia.co.om (Muscat Daily News)
title: Oman finishes 23rd in the 27th Nomura Cup
text:
Oman finishes 23rd in the 27th Nomura Cup October 26, 2015 
The Oman's quartet of Azaan al Rumhy, Ali Hameed, Hamed al Rumhy and Rashad al Harthy could only manage a 23rd-place finish on their debut in the 27th Nomura Cup, one of the world’s most prestigious amateur team golf championships, that concluded in Abu Dhabi, UAE on Sunday. 
Oman scored a total of 118 over for 982 over four days at the 72-hole course to take the 23rd spot among 27 countries. 
Japan clinched the title with a score of 22 under par for 842 to edge Chinese Taipei on countback, which too finished with 842. South Korea won the third place with a 16 under 848. It was the eighth title for Japan. 
In the individual category, Azaan finished 69th with a total of 25 over 313, while Ali Hameed shot 46 over 334 to finish 88th. Rashad al Harthy had a score of 54 over 342 for the 92nd rank, while Hamed al Rumhy carded 69 over 357 for the 98th place among a field of 102 golfers. China’s Cheng Jin, with a 13 under 275 was the best golfer. 
The Nomura Cup began in 1963 as a tri-nation tournament in the Philippines when the host nation took on Japan and China. Today, there are 39 member countries affiliated to the Asia Pacific Golf Confederation, the event organiser. Similar content
